question_text: Our Access Dance strategy plans for us to deliver 40 week programming in each of the following cities each year (Fort McMurray, Grande Prarie, Edmonton (Africa Centre), Red Deer, Calgary (Ogden Hub:29), and Medicine Hat). Did we deliver any Access Dance programs to these cities across the province this reporting period?
In which cities?
How long were the each of the programs delivered (weeks)?
List any partners by city if there were any.
How many students did we serve in each city?
What feedback did we receive from participants or partners about our programming? Were there any issues raised?
Do we have plans to deliver the program later this year?
In which cities and when?
Why not?
Are there any cities in our Access Dance strategy that we're not planning to deliver this year?
In which cities and why aren't we delivering this program?

Our Access Dance - Rural strategy plans for us to deliver 40 week programming in each of the following rural communities each year (Valleyview, Peace River, High Prairie, Spirit River, Camrose, Ponoka, Rocky Mountain House, Stettler, Olds, Oyen, Foremost, Manyberries, Taber). Did we deliver any Access Dance programs to these cities across the province this reporting period?
In which communities?
How long were the each of the programs delivered (weeks)?
List any partners by community if there were any.
How many students did we serve in each community?
What feedback did we receive from participants or partners about our programming? Were there any issues raised?
Do we have plans to deliver the program later this year?
In which communities and when?
Why not?
Are there any cities in our Access Dance - Rural strategy that we're not planning to deliver this year?
In which cities and why aren't we delivering this program?

Our Powwow & Ballet strategy plans for us to deliver 6 week programming in each of the following cities each year (High Level, Fort McMurray, Fort McKay, Cold Lake, Grande Prarie, Edmonton, Red Deer, Calgary, Lethbridge, and Medicine Hat). Did we deliver any Powwow & Ballet programs to these cities across the province this reporting period?
In which cities?
Other than ISCA, list any other partners in those cities if there were any.
How many students did we serve in each city?
What feedback did we receive from participants or partners about Powwow & Ballet? Were there any issues raised?
Do we have plans to deliver the program later this year?
In which cities and when?
Why not?
Are there any cities in our Powwow & Ballet strategy that we're not planning to deliver this year?
In which cities and why aren't we delivering this program?

Our Newcomers Programming strategy plans for us to deliver 40 week programming in each of the following cities each year (Fort McMurray, Edmonton (Action for Healthy Communities), Calgary (Centre for Newcomers and Canadian Immigrant Women's Association), and Medicine Hat (Saamis Immigration)). Did we launch targeted marketing campaigns for Alberta Ballet recreational classes this reporting period in Calgary?
If yes, which campaigns did we run (channels, audiences, key messages)?
What measurable results did these campaigns generate (inquiries, website visits, registrations, engagement) in Calgary?
If not, what prevented us from running targeted campaigns this period (budget, timing, capacity, creative)?
Did we see growth in new or returning students in Alberta Ballet recreational classes this reporting period compared to a typical month in Calgary?
If yes, how many NEW recreational students registered this period (best estimate is fine)?
If yes, how many RETURNING recreational students continued or re-registered this period?
If there was no growth or a decline, what do you think contributed (competition, schedule, pricing, awareness)?
Did we intentionally target or reach underrepresented or equity-deserving groups in marketing for recreational classes this reporting period in Calgary?
If yes, which groups did we focus on (e.g., newcomers, Indigenous families, racialised communities, low-income neighbourhoods) and what tactics did we use?
If not, what opportunities or partners could help us reach more diverse students in future periods?
Did we enrol any self-disclosing diverse students (e.g., newcomers, Indigenous, racialised, low-income, disability) in recreational classes this reporting period in Calgary?
If yes, how many self-disclosing diverse students enrolled or continued this period?
If not, what might be limiting access for these students (location, cost, transportation, awareness, cultural barriers)?
Did we offer discounted or sponsored performance tickets to recreational students or their families this reporting period in Calgary?
If yes, how many discounted or sponsored tickets did we provide and to which performances?
If yes, through which channels or partners were these tickets distributed (schools, community groups, direct to families)?
If not, what prevented us from offering discounted or sponsored tickets this period?
